statement:
Let $\phi$ be a smooth planar dynamical system and $\gamma$ a continuous
curve which has a tangent vector at each point *(i.e. $\gamma$ is
differentiable)*. Then there is a contact point between any two points
of the intersection of $\gamma$ and a separating solution of $\phi$.
[@1]

[1]{} Khovanskiĭ, A.G.: Fewnomials. American Mathematical Society,
Providence, 1991.
names: Rolle's theorem for dynamical systems in the plane
